name: Juliana Rabbi - Remote Work Coach
content: Do women need to choose between a career and being a good mother?I know. Most people will say that, once you become a mother, you will never be able to prioritize your career again. You are "kind of done" with that.I disagree. â–ªï¸ In case you are wondering, I'm not a mother. But I have close friends, clients and women around me who are mothers, and I want to share the perspective I heard from some of them about being a mother. âš ï¸ Warning: this might change the way you approach being a mother and taking care of you careerA lot of mothers dream about a career that allows them to:âœ”ï¸ Bring their young kids to school and pick them backâœ”ï¸ Have lunch with them every dayâœ”ï¸Travel with the kids during the school holidays and work from thereâœ”ï¸ Spend time home when the kid got sick âœ”ï¸ Be able to spend more quality time with the kid, instead of arriving home from the office late and extremely tired, when the kid is about to go to bedğŸ”˜ Are those things even possible to happen?The answer is yes.ğŸ”¹ When you have a remote job, you have more flexibility and autonomy to use your time as you wish.You can be an amazing and dedicated professional, and, at the same time,Â  a great mom who spends time with her family and enjoys it.ğŸ”¸ I know things are more complex than that, but I want to bring your attention to the fact that working remotely will significantly increase the chances that you can keep improving your career after you have kids.The "traditional office life" is not kid friendly - and I'm sure you knew that already. What you may not know is that more and more moms are working remotely (or from home) and improving their life quality, spending more times with their kids and still being promoted.â¡ï¸ If you are a mother (or are planning to be one), and you also care about your career, I can help you to land a remote job.You will need to figure out a way to raise your kids and live life on your own terms...But I can help you to deal with the career part.â­ï¸ Send me a direct message and let's talk.#jobsearch #remotejobs #remotework #homeoffice #workfromhome

name: Ãlvaro GarcÃ­a Lorenzo
content: El post llega unos dÃ­as tarde (con algÃºn que otro problema logÃ­stico de por medio). El viaje a Londres con los compaÃ±eros del MÃ¡ster en gestiÃ³n de empresas marÃ­timo-portuarias y Derecho marÃ­timo de la University of Deusto  ha sido una experiencia increÃ­ble. Antes de nada, quiero hablar sobre las dos visitas que tuvimos el dÃ­a despuÃ©s de estar en la  International Maritime Organization y en el Lloyd's Register AsÃ­, tuvimos el placer de visitar el Britannia P&I Club, primer club de P&I del mundo y referente en el sector marÃ­timo; ademÃ¡s de la sede de International Oil Pollution Compensation Funds (IOPC Funds), vitales a la hora de mitigar los daÃ±os que pudiesen causar desastres debidos a la contaminaciÃ³n por hidrocarburos resultante de derrames de hidrocarburos persistentes de buques tanque.Gracias a sendas oportunidades, los conocimientos que hemos ido ganando a lo largo del curso se han visto reforzados y no podemos aguantar mÃ¡s las ganas de finalizar esta etapa y empezar a crecer dentro del sector marÃ­timo.Con todo, me gustarÃ­a agradecer a mis compaÃ±eros por los magnÃ­ficos momentos vividos, tanto en las visitas como en el tiempo de ocio del que disfrutamos (en algÃºn que otro pub nos conocen ya de sobra). Finalmente, no podÃ­a olvidarme de Fernando. No se me ocurrirÃ­a nadie mejor para poder compartir, disfrutar y aprender a la vez. name: Pablo SÃ¡nchez Arias
content: Boost Your R Code's Performance with parSapply ğŸš€Hey LinkedIn fam! ğŸ‘‹ Are you looking to supercharge your R code and make it run faster? ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸ Today, I want to share with you an amazing function in R called parSapply that can significantly speed up your computations. ğŸ’¨parSapply is a parallel computing function in R that allows you to distribute computations across multiple cores or processors, harnessing the power of parallel processing. ğŸš€ By using parSapply, you can take advantage of the full processing power of your machine, making your code more efficient and saving you precious time âŒ›.Here's a simple example of how parSapply can be used to speed up your code:```R# Load the parallel packagelibrary(parallel)# Define a function to be applied in parallelmy_function <- function(x) {Â # Perform some computationally intensive taskÂ # ...}# Create a vector of inputsmy_data <- 1:100# Apply the function in parallel using parSapplyresults <- parSapply(my_data, my_function)```In this example, parSapply distributes the computations of the `my_function` across multiple cores, processing each element of `my_data` simultaneously. This can lead to a significant speedup compared to the sequential version of the code.By leveraging parallel processing with parSapply, you can tackle computationally intensive tasks more efficiently, such as large-scale simulations, data processing, or complex calculations. ğŸ’ªSo, if you find yourself working with large datasets or performing repetitive calculations in R, give parSapply a try! It's a powerful tool that can make a noticeable difference in your code's performance. âš¡ï¸If you're interested in learning more about optimizing your R code and unlocking its full potential, I highly recommend checking out DataCamp's course "Writing Efficient R Code" (link: [https://lnkd.in/dVwBqbAN]). It covers various techniques and best practices to improve the efficiency and speed of your R code.Remember, in today's data-driven world, every second counts when it comes to data analysis and processing. Stay ahead of the game by optimizing your R code with parSapply and other performance-enhancing techniques. Happy coding! ğŸ’»âœ¨#RProgramming #DataScience #ParallelProcessing #EfficientCoding #DataCamp
